images.caption: Figure 1:CMs (left) are weakly supervised ODE solvers, only learning to map points along a trajectory that are near the trajectoryâ€™s origin back to the origin itself; points that are far from the origin instead enforce a self-consistency property, relying on weak self-supervision to solve the PF ODE. Direct CMs (right) are strongly supervised ODE solvers, instead learning to directly map all points along a trajectory back to the origin.
Figure 2:Samples generated by both CMs and Direct CMs. The samples produced by CMs are clearly of higher quality. All corresponding images are generated from the same initial noise.

Figure 5:Additional images generated by both CMs and Direct CMs, further highlighting the sample quality difference between the two models. All corresponding images are generated from the same initial noise.
